snippet: European Union antitrust authorities raided the offices of major telecommunications companies this week in an inquiry into anticompetitive behavior.
abstract: European Commission says it has investigated major telecommunications companies, including Germany's Deutsche Telekom, France's Orange and Spain's Telefonica, on suspicion that companies are using dominant market positions to limit Internet providers' access to their networks.
lead_paragraph: European Union antitrust authorities raided the offices of major telecommunications companies this week in an inquiry into anticompetitive behavior.

headline.main: Antitrust Scrutiny of Telecoms in Europe
headline.print_headline: Antitrust Scrutiny Of Telecoms In Europe
